intro: Cuphea punctulata, commonly known as the spotted cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 3 to 6 feet, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, which bloom in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Cuphea punctulata is also known for its ability to attract hummingbirds and other pollinators due to its nectar-rich flowers.
